alert.note: Alert for Madison; Orange (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 19 at 8:25PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Virginia and northwest Virginia, including the following counties: in central Virginia, Orange. In northwest Virginia, Madison. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 825 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orange... Madison... Gordonsville... Brightwood... Montford... Madison Mills... Montpelier Station... Twymans Mill... Old Somerset... Aroda... Somerset... Locust Dale... Rochelle... Madison Run... Oakpark... Pratts... Shelby... Wolftown... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
